intro: Argostemma triflorum, commonly known as the three-flowered argostemma, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters of three, giving it its common name. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
